xxl.core.indexStructures.builder

Class IndexConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.indexStructures.builder.IndexConfiguration
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BPlusConfiguration

    public abstract class IndexConfiguration
extends Object
    An abstract class for setting up requirements for a given index structure needed for a concrete IndexBuilder. Depending of the concrete index structure an IndexConfiguration implementation could specify all the customizations of this index structure, e.g. if it should be kept in memory or stored on the hard drive.

    How to add own new builders
    If you want to write your own builder for a new index structure ensure first that this structure inherits from abstract class Tree. After this create a concrete implementation this abstract class IndexConfiguration in which you create getter and setter and also default values for all the customizations for your index structure. When writing your own IndexConfiguration implementation you have to implement the method getBuilder() at least. In this method you have to construct your concrete builder and return it.
    See Also:
    Easily create or restore index structures, Setting up the requirements for the BPlus tree

    • Method Detail

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Return the current block size in Byte for the underlying storage medium used in BPlusTree constructor.

        Note: Because this only used by the BPlus tree builder the visibility of this method is restricted to package wide visibility.
        Returns:
        Block size in Byte.

      • getBuffer

        public Buffer getBuffer()
        Returns the current buffer used for the BPlus tree. By default it's a single (unshared) LRU buffer with a capacity of INDEX_REQUIREMENTS_DEFAULT_LRU_BUFFER_SIZE items.

        Note: Because this only used by the BPlus tree builder the visibility of this method is restricted to package wide visibility.
        Returns:
        the buffer
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • getBufferedContainer

        public BufferedContainer getBufferedContainer()
        Returns the buffered container which should be used by the BPlus tree

        Note: Because this only used by the BPlus tree builder the visibility of this method is restricted to package wide visibility.
        Returns:
        the buffered container
        See Also:
        Container

      • getBuilder

        public abstract IndexBuilder getBuilder()
        Returns a builder which can create an index structure that satisfy the given configuration.
        Returns:
        The builder

      • getFileSystemFilePath

        public String getFileSystemFilePath()
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the path in which the BPlus tree stores it data in case of storing the BPlus tree persistent at the hard drive. Please note that the file name is taken from the meta data table name.

        Note: Because this only used by the BPlus tree builder the visibility of this method is restricted to package wide visibility.
        Returns:
        The file path excluding the file extension.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the BPlus tree should be stored at main memory because there is no file system path to return.

      • getLocation

        public IndexConfiguration.Location getLocation()
        Returns the location where the BPlus tree should be stored.

        Note: Because this only used by the BPlus tree builder the visibility of this method is restricted to package wide visibility.
        Returns:
        the BPlus tree location
        See Also:
        IndexConfiguration.Location

      • overrideBufferContainer

        protected void overrideBufferContainer(BufferedContainer bc)

      • storeAtFileSystem

        public boolean storeAtFileSystem()
        Indicates if the current configuration will force an index to store itself at file system or on main memory. By default it is stored in main memory.
        Returns:
        true if the index ist stored at hard drive, otherwise false

      • updateBufferContainer

        protected void updateBufferContainer()
